DigitalInput.title: DigitalInput
DigitalInput.description: Generic digital input for non-specific sensors

5500.description: The current state of a digital input.

5501.description: The cumulative value of active state detected.

5502.description: The polarity of the digital input as a Boolean (0 = Normal, 1= Reversed).

5504.description: The edge selection as an integer (1 = Falling edge, 2 = Rising edge, 3 = Both Rising and Falling edge).

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

5751.description: The type of the sensor (for instance PIR type).

DigitalOutput.title: DigitalOutput
DigitalOutput.description: Generic digital output for non-specific actuators

5550.description: The current state of a digital output,  0=OFF, 1=ON..

5551.description: The polarity of a digital ouput as a Boolean (0 = Normal, 1= Reversed).

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

AnalogInput.title: AnalogInput
AnalogInput.description: Generic analog input for non-specific sensors

5600.description: The current value of the analog input.

5601.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

5602.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5603.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5604.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5605.description: Reset the Min and Max Measured Values to Current Value.

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

5751.description: The type of the sensor (for instance PIR type).

AnalogOutput.title: AnalogOutput
AnalogOutput.description: generic object that can be used with any kind of analog output interface.

5603.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5604.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5650.description: The current state of the analogue output.

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

GenericSensor.title: GenericSensor
GenericSensor.description: It is based on the description of a value and a unit according to the UCUM specification. Thus, any type of value defined within this specification can be reporting using this object. Specific object for a given range of sensors is described later in the document, enabling to identify the type of sensors directly from its Object ID. This object may be used as a generic object if a dedicated one does not exist.

5601.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

5602.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5603.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5604.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5605.description: Reset the Min and Max Measured Values to Current Value.

5700.description: Last or Current Measured Value from the Sensor.

5701.description: If present, the type of sensor defined as the UCUM Unit Definition e.g. “Cel” for Temperature in Celcius.

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

5751.description: The type of the sensor (for instance PIR type).

5601.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

5602.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5603.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5604.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5605.description: Reset the Min and Max Measured Values to Current Value.

5700.description: Last or Current Measured Value from the Sensor.

5701.description: If present, the type of sensor defined as the UCUM Unit Definition e.g. “Cel” for Temperature in Celcius.

PresenceSensor.title: PresenceSensor
PresenceSensor.description: Presence sensor with digital sensing, optional delay parameters

5500.description: The current state of a digital input.

5501.description: The cumulative value of active state detected.

5751.description: The type of the sensor (for instance PIR type).

5903.description: Delay from the detection state to the clear state in ms.

5904.description: Delay from the clear state to the busy state in ms.

TemperatureSensor.title: TemperatureSensor
TemperatureSensor.description: used with a temperature sensor to report a temperature measurement.  It also provides resources for minimum/maximum measured values and the minimum/maximum range that can be measured by the temperature sensor. An example measurement unit is degrees Celsius

5601.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

5602.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5603.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5604.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5605.description: Reset the Min and Max Measured Values to Current Value.

5700.description: Last or Current Measured Value from the Sensor.

5701.description: If present, the type of sensor defined as the UCUM Unit Definition e.g. “Cel” for Temperature in Celcius.

HumiditySensor.title: HumiditySensor
HumiditySensor.description: used with a humidity sensor to report a humidity measurement.  It also provides resources for minimum/maximum measured values and the minimum/maximum range that can be measured by the humidity sensor. An example measurement unit is relative humidity as a percentage

5601.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

5602.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5603.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5604.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5605.description: Reset the Min and Max Measured Values to Current Value.

5700.description: Last or Current Measured Value from the Sensor.

5701.description: If present, the type of sensor defined as the UCUM Unit Definition e.g. “Cel” for Temperature in Celcius.

PowerMeasurment.title: PowerMeasurment
PowerMeasurment.description: used over a power measurement sensor to report a remote power measurement.  It also provides resources for minimum/maximum measured values and the minimum/maximum range for both active and reactive power. Il also provides resources for cumulative energy, calibration, and the power factor.

5605.description: Reset the Min and Max Measured Values to Current Value.

5801.description: The minimum active power measured by the sensor since it is ON.

5802.description: The maximum active power measured by the sensor since it is ON.

5803.description: The minimum active power that can be measured by the sensor.

5804.description: The maximum active power that can be measured by the sensor.

5805.description: The total power in Wh that the light has used.

5806.description: Request an active power calibration by writing the value of a calibrated load.

5811.description: The minimum reactive power measured by the sensor since it is ON.

5812.description: The maximum reactive power measured by the sensor since it is ON.

5813.description: The minimum active power that can be measured by the sensor.

5814.description: The minimum active power that can be measured by the sensor.

5815.description: The cumulative reactive power since the last cumulative energy reset or device start.

5816.description: Request a reactive power calibration by writing the value of a calibrated load.

5820.description: The power factor of the actuactor.

5821.description: Read or Write the current calibration coefficient.

Actuation.title: Actuation
Actuation.description: dedicated to remote actuation such as ON/OFF action or dimming. A multi-state output can also be described as a string. This is useful to send pilot wire orders for instance. It also provides a resource to reflect the time that the device has been switched on.

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

5850.description: This resource represents a power source, which can be controlled, the setting of which is a Boolean value (1,0) where 1 is on and 0 is off

5851.description: This resource represents dimmer setting, which has an Integer value between 0 and 100 as a percentage.

5852.description: The time in seconds that the device has been on. Writing a value of 0 resets the counter.

5853.description: A string describing a state for multiple level output such as Pilot Wire.

SetPoint.title: SetPoint
SetPoint.description: used to set a desired value to a controller, such as a thermostat. This object enables a setpoint to be expressed units defined in the UCUM specification, to match an associated sensor or measurement value. A special resource is added to set the colour of an object

5701.description: If present, the type of sensor defined as the UCUM Unit Definition e.g. “Cel” for Temperature in Celcius.

5706.description: A string representing a value in some color space

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

LoadControl.title: LoadControl
LoadControl.description: used for demand-response load control and other load control in automation application (not limited to power)

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

5823.description: The event identifier as a string.

5824.description: Time when the load control event will start started.

5825.description: The duration of the load control event.

5826.description: The criticality of the event.  The device receiving the event will react in an appropriate fashion for the device.

5827.description: Defines the maximum energy usage of the receivng device, as a percentage of the device's normal maximum energy usage.

5828.description: Defines the duty cycle for the load control event, i.e, what percentage of time the receiving device is allowed to be on.

LightControl.title: LightControl
LightControl.description: used to control a light source, such as a LED or other light.  It allows a light to be turned on or off and its dimmer setting to be control as a % between 0 and 100. An optional colour setting enables a string to be used to indicate the desired colour.

5701.description: If present, the type of sensor defined as the UCUM Unit Definition e.g. “Cel” for Temperature in Celcius.

5706.description: A string representing a value in some color space

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

5805.description: The total power in Wh that the light has used.

5820.description: The power factor of the actuactor.

5850.description: This resource represents a power source, which can be controlled, the setting of which is a Boolean value (1,0) where 1 is on and 0 is off

5851.description: This resource represents dimmer setting, which has an Integer value between 0 and 100 as a percentage.

5852.description: The time in seconds that the device has been on. Writing a value of 0 resets the counter.

PowerControl.title: PowerControl
PowerControl.description: used to control a power source, such as a Smart Plug.  It allows a power relay to be turned on or off and its dimmer setting to be control as a % between 0 and 100.

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

5805.description: The total power in Wh that the light has used.

5820.description: The power factor of the actuactor.

5850.description: This resource represents a power source, which can be controlled, the setting of which is a Boolean value (1,0) where 1 is on and 0 is off

5851.description: This resource represents dimmer setting, which has an Integer value between 0 and 100 as a percentage.

5852.description: The time in seconds that the device has been on. Writing a value of 0 resets the counter.

Accelerometer.title: Accelerometer
Accelerometer.description: can be used to represent a 1-3 axis accelerometer.

5603.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5604.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5701.description: If present, the type of sensor defined as the UCUM Unit Definition e.g. “Cel” for Temperature in Celcius.

5702.description: The measured value along the X axis.

5703.description: The measured value along the Y axis.

5704.description: The measured value along the Z axis.

Magnetometer.title: Magnetometer
Magnetometer.description: used to represent a 1-3 axis magnetometer with optional compass direction.

5701.description: If present, the type of sensor defined as the UCUM Unit Definition e.g. “Cel” for Temperature in Celcius.

5702.description: The measured value along the X axis.

5703.description: The measured value along the Y axis.

5704.description: The measured value along the Z axis.

Barometer.title: Barometer
Barometer.description: used with an air pressure sensor to report a barometer measurement.  It also provides resources for minimum/maximum measured values and the minimum/maximum range that can be measured by the barometer sensor. An example measurement unit is kPa (ucum:kPa).

5601.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

5602.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5603.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5604.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5605.description: Reset the Min and Max Measured Values to Current Value.

5700.description: Last or Current Measured Value from the Sensor.

5701.description: If present, the type of sensor defined as the UCUM Unit Definition e.g. “Cel” for Temperature in Celcius.

Voltage.title: Voltage
Voltage.description: used with voltmeter sensor to report measured voltage between two points.  It also provides resources for minimum and maximum measured values, as well as the minimum and maximum range that can be measured by the sensor. An example measurement unit is volts

5601.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

5602.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5603.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5604.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5605.description: Reset the Min and Max Measured Values to Current Value.

5700.description: Last or Current Measured Value from the Sensor.

5701.description: If present, the type of sensor defined as the UCUM Unit Definition e.g. “Cel” for Temperature in Celcius.

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

5821.description: Read or Write the current calibration coefficient.

Current.title: Current
Current.description: used with an ampmeter to report measured electric current in amperes. It also provides resources for minimum and maximum measured values, as well as the minimum and maximum range that can be measured by the sensor. An example measurement unit is volts

5601.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

5602.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5603.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5604.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5605.description: Reset the Min and Max Measured Values to Current Value.

5700.description: Last or Current Measured Value from the Sensor.

5701.description: If present, the type of sensor defined as the UCUM Unit Definition e.g. “Cel” for Temperature in Celcius.

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

5821.description: Read or Write the current calibration coefficient.

Frequency.title: Frequency
Frequency.description: used to report frequency measurements. It also provides resources for minimum and maximum measured values, as well as the minimum and maximum range that can be measured by the sensor. An example measurement unit is volts

5601.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

5602.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

5821.description: Read or Write the current calibration coefficient.

Depth.title: Depth
Depth.description: used to report depth measurements. It can, for example, be used to describe a generic rain gauge that measures the accumulated rainfall in millimetres (mm) or in fathoms (fth)

5601.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

5602.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5603.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5604.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5605.description: Reset the Min and Max Measured Values to Current Value.

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

5821.description: Read or Write the current calibration coefficient.

Percentage.title: Percentage
Percentage.description: used to report measurements relative to a 0-100% scale. For example it could be used to measure the level of a liquid in a vessel or container in units of %

5601.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

5602.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5603.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5604.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5605.description: Reset the Min and Max Measured Values to Current Value.

5701.description: If present, the type of sensor defined as the UCUM Unit Definition e.g. “Cel” for Temperature in Celcius.

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

5821.description: Read or Write the current calibration coefficient.

Altitude.title: Altitude
Altitude.description: used with an altitude sensor to report altitude above sea level in meters. Note that Altitude can be calculated from the measured pressure given the local sea level pressure.  It also provides resources for minimum and maximum measured values, as well as the minimum and maximum range that can be measured by the sensor. An example measurement unit is meters

5601.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

5602.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5603.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5604.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

Load.title: Load
Load.description: used with a load sensor (as in a scale) to report the applied weight or force. It also provides resources for minimum and maximum measured values, as well as the minimum and maximum range that can be measured by the sensor. An example measurement unit is kilograms

5601.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

5602.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5603.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5604.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5605.description: Reset the Min and Max Measured Values to Current Value.

5701.description: If present, the type of sensor defined as the UCUM Unit Definition e.g. “Cel” for Temperature in Celcius.

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

5821.description: Read or Write the current calibration coefficient.

Pressure.title: Pressure
Pressure.description: used to report pressure measurements. It also provides resources for minimum and maximum measured values, as well as the minimum and maximum range that can be measured by the sensor. An example measurement unit is pascals

5601.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

5602.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5603.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5604.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5821.description: Read or Write the current calibration coefficient.

Loudness.title: Loudness
Loudness.description: used to report loudness or noise level measurements. It also provides resources for minimum and maximum measured values, as well as the minimum and maximum range that can be measured by the sensor. An example measurement unit is decibels

5601.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

5602.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

Concentration.title: Concentration
Concentration.description: used to the particle concentration measurement of a medium. It also provides resources for minimum and maximum measured values, as well as the minimum and maximum range that can be measured by the sensor. An example measurement unit is parts per million

5601.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

5602.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

Acidity.title: Acidity
Acidity.description: used to report an acidity measurement of a liquid. It also provides resources for minimum and maximum measured values, as well as the minimum and maximum range that can be measured by the sensor. An example measurement unit is pH.

5601.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

5602.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5604.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5701.description: If present, the type of sensor defined as the UCUM Unit Definition e.g. “Cel” for Temperature in Celcius.

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

5821.description: Read or Write the current calibration coefficient.

Conductivity.title: Conductivity
Conductivity.description: used to report a measurement of the electric conductivity of a medium or sample. It also provides resources for minimum and maximum measured values, as well as the minimum and maximum range that can be measured by the sensor. An example measurement unit is Siemens

5601.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

5602.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5603.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5604.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5605.description: Reset the Min and Max Measured Values to Current Value.

5700.description: Last or Current Measured Value from the Sensor.

5701.description: If present, the type of sensor defined as the UCUM Unit Definition e.g. “Cel” for Temperature in Celcius.

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

5821.description: Read or Write the current calibration coefficient.

Power.title: Power
Power.description: This IPSO object should be used to report power measurements. It also provides resources for minimum and maximum measured values, as well as the minimum and maximum range that can be measured by the sensor. An example measurement unit is Watts (ucum: W). This resource may be used for either real power or apparent power (units= ucum:VA) measurements. The Application type can be use for reactive power or active power for example.

5601.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

5602.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5603.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5604.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5605.description: Reset the Min and Max Measured Values to Current Value.

5700.description: Last or Current Measured Value from the Sensor.

5701.description: If present, the type of sensor defined as the UCUM Unit Definition e.g. “Cel” for Temperature in Celcius.

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

5821.description: Read or Write the current calibration coefficient.

PowerFactor.title: PowerFactor
PowerFactor.description: report a measurement or calculation of the power factor of a reactive electrical load. Power Factor is normally the ratio of non-reactive power to total power. This object also provides resources for minimum and maximum measured values, as well as the minimum and maximum range that can be measured by the sensor.

5601.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

5602.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5603.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5604.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5605.description: Reset the Min and Max Measured Values to Current Value.

5700.description: Last or Current Measured Value from the Sensor.

5701.description: If present, the type of sensor defined as the UCUM Unit Definition e.g. “Cel” for Temperature in Celcius.

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

5821.description: Read or Write the current calibration coefficient.

Distance.title: Distance
Distance.description: report a distance measurement. It also provides resources for minimum and maximum measured values, as well as the minimum and maximum range that can be measured by the sensor. An example measurement unit is Meters

5601.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

5602.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5603.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5604.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5701.description: If present, the type of sensor defined as the UCUM Unit Definition e.g. “Cel” for Temperature in Celcius.

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

5821.description: Read or Write the current calibration coefficient.

Energy.title: Energy
Energy.description: report energy consumption (Cumulative Power) of an electrical load. An example measurement unit is Watt Hours (ucum:W*h)

5701.description: If present, the type of sensor defined as the UCUM Unit Definition e.g. “Cel” for Temperature in Celcius.

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

5805.description: The total power in Wh that the light has used.

Direction.title: Direction
Direction.description: report the direction indicated by a compass, wind vane, or other directional indicator. The units of measure is plane angle degrees

5601.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

5602.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5605.description: Reset the Min and Max Measured Values to Current Value.

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

Time.title: Time
Time.description: report the current time in seconds since January 1, 1970 UTC. There is also a fractional time counter that has a range of less than one second.

5506.description: Unix Time. A signed integer representing the number of seconds since Jan 1st, 1970 in the UTC time zone.

5507.description: For shorter times of a fraction of a second (i.e. 0.23).

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

Gyrometer.title: Gyrometer
Gyrometer.description: report the current reading of a gyrometer sensor in 3 axes. It provides tracking of the minimum and maximum angular rate in all 3 axes. An example unit of measure is radians per second (ucum:rad/s)

5508.description: The minimum measured value along the X axis.

5509.description: The maximum measured value along the X axis.

5510.description: The minimum measured value along the Y axis.

5511.description: The maximum measured value along the Y axis.

5512.description: The minimum measured value along the Z axis.

5513.description: The maximum measured value along the Z axis.

5603.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5604.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5605.description: Reset the Min and Max Measured Values to Current Value.

5701.description: If present, the type of sensor defined as the UCUM Unit Definition e.g. “Cel” for Temperature in Celcius.

5702.description: The measured value along the X axis.

5703.description: The measured value along the Y axis.

5704.description: The measured value along the Z axis.

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

Color.title: Color
Color.description: report the measured value of a colour sensor in some colour space described by the units resource.

5701.description: If present, the type of sensor defined as the UCUM Unit Definition e.g. “Cel” for Temperature in Celcius.

5706.description: A string representing a value in some color space

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

GpsLocation.title: GpsLocation
GpsLocation.description: represents GPS coordinates. This object is compatible with the LWM2M management object for location, but uses reusable resources.

5514.description: The decimal notation of latitude, e.g. -43.5723 (World Geodetic System 1984).

5515.description: The decimal notation of longitude, e.g. 153.21760 (World Geodetic System 1984).

5516.description: The accuracy of the position in meters.

5517.description: The velocity of the device as defined in 3GPP 23.032 GAD specification. This set of values may not be available if the device is static.

5518.description: The timestamp of when the location measurement was performed.

Positioner.title: Positioner
Positioner.description: used with a generic position actuator from 0 to 100%. This resource optionally allows setting the transition time for an operation that changes the position of the actuator, and for reading the remaining time of the currently active transition

5519.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5520.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5536.description: Current position or desired position of a positioner actuator.

5537.description: The time expected to move the actuator to the new position.

5538.description: The time remaining in an operation.

5601.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

5602.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5605.description: Reset the Min and Max Measured Values to Current Value.

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

Buzzer.title: Buzzer
Buzzer.description: actuate an audible alarm such as a buzzer, beeper, or vibration alarm. There is a dimmer control for setting the relative loudness of the alarm, and an optional duration control to limit the length of time the alarm sounds when turned on. Each time a “1” is written to the On/Off resource, the alarm will sound again for the configured duration. If no duration is programmed or the setting is zero, writing a “1” to the On/Off resource will result in the alarm sounding continuously until a “0” is written to the On/Off resource.

5521.description: The duration of the time delay.

5525.description: The off time when On/Off control remains on.

5548.description: Input/output level control, float value between 0 and 100 as a percentage.

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

5850.description: This resource represents a power source, which can be controlled, the setting of which is a Boolean value (1,0) where 1 is on and 0 is off

AudioClip.title: AudioClip
AudioClip.description: used for a speaker that plays a pre-recorded audio clip or an audio output that is sent elsewhere. For example, an elevator which announces the floor of the building. A resource is provided to store the clip, a dimmer resource controls the relative sound level of the playback, and a duration resource limits the maximum playback time. After the duration time is reached, any remaining samples in the clip are ignored, and the clip player will be ready to play another clip.

5522.description: Audio Clip that is playable (i.e. short audio recording indicating the floor in an elevator).

5524.description: The duration of the sound once trigger.

5548.description: Input/output level control, float value between 0 and 100 as a percentage.

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

Timer.title: Timer
Timer.description: used to time events and actions, using patterns common to industrial timers. A POST to the trigger resource or On/Off input state change starts the timing operation, and the timer remaining time shows zero when the operation is complete. The patterns supported are One-Shot (mode 1), On-Time or Interval (mode 2), Time delay on pick-up or TDPU (tmode 3), and Time Delay on Drop-Out or TDDO (mode 4). Mode 0 disables the timer, so the output follows the input with no delay. A counter is provided to count occurrences of the timer output changing from 0 to 1. Writing a value of zero resets the counter. The Digital Input State resource reports the state of the timer output

5501.description: The cumulative value of active state detected.

5521.description: The duration of the time delay.

5525.description: The off time when On/Off control remains on.

5526.description: type of timer pattern used by the patterns.

5534.description: Counts the number of times the timer output transitions from 0 to 1.

5538.description: The time remaining in an operation.

5543.description: The current state of the timer output.

5544.description: The total time in seconds that the timer input is true. Writing a 0 resets the time.

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

5850.description: This resource represents a power source, which can be controlled, the setting of which is a Boolean value (1,0) where 1 is on and 0 is off

AddressableTextDisplay.title: AddressableTextDisplay
AddressableTextDisplay.description: used to send text to a text-only or text mode graphics display. POSTing a string of text to the text resource causes it to be displayed at the selected X and Y locations on the display. If X or Y are set to a value greater than the size of the display, the position “wraps around” to the modulus of the setting and the display size. Likewise, if the text string overflows the display size, the text “wraps around” and displays on the next line down or, if the last line has been written, wraps around to the top of the display. Brightness and Contrast controls are provided to allow control of various display types including STN and DSTN type LCD character displays. POSTing an empty payload to the Clear Display resource causes the display to be erased.

5531.description: Proportional control, integer value between 0 and 100 as a percentage.

5545.description: The highest X coordinate the display supports before wrapping to the next line.

5546.description: The highest Y coordinate the display supports before wrapping to the next line.

5548.description: Input/output level control, float value between 0 and 100 as a percentage.

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

5850.description: This resource represents a power source, which can be controlled, the setting of which is a Boolean value (1,0) where 1 is on and 0 is off

OnOffSwitch.title: OnOffSwitch
OnOffSwitch.description: used with an On/Off switch to report the state of the switch.

5500.description: The current state of a digital input.

5501.description: The cumulative value of active state detected.

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

5852.description: The time in seconds that the device has been on. Writing a value of 0 resets the counter.

5854.description: The time in seconds since the Off command was sent. Writing a value of 0 resets the counter.

LevelControl.title: LevelControl
LevelControl.description: used with a dimmer or level control to report the state of the control.

5548.description: Input/output level control, float value between 0 and 100 as a percentage.

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

5852.description: The time in seconds that the device has been on. Writing a value of 0 resets the counter.

UpDownControl.title: UpDownControl
UpDownControl.description: used to report the state of an up/down control element like a pair of push buttons or a rotary encoder. Counters for increase and decrease operations are provided for counting pulses from a quadrature encoder

5541.description: Counts the number of times the increase control has been operated. Writing a 0 resets the counter.

5542.description: Counts the times the decrease control has been operated. Writing a 0 resets the counter

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

MultipleAxisJoystick.title: MultipleAxisJoystick
MultipleAxisJoystick.description: report the position of a shuttle or joystick control. A digital input is provided to report the state of an associated push button.

5500.description: The current state of a digital input.

5501.description: The cumulative value of active state detected.

5702.description: The measured value along the X axis.

5703.description: The measured value along the Y axis.

5704.description: The measured value along the Z axis.

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

Rate.title: Rate
Rate.description: report a rate measurement, for example the speed of a vehicle, or the rotational speed of a drive shaft. It also provides resources for minimum and maximum measured values, as well as the minimum and maximum range that can be measured by the sensor.An example measurement unit is Feet per Second (ucum:ft_us/s)

5601.description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor

5602.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5604.description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

PushButton.title: PushButton
PushButton.description: report the state of a momentary action push button control and to count the number of times the control has been operated since the last observation.

5500.description: The current state of a digital input.

5501.description: The cumulative value of active state detected.

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

MultistateSelector.title: MultistateSelector
MultistateSelector.description: represent the state of a Multi-state selector switch with a number of fixed positions.

5547.description: The current state of a Multi-state input or selector.

Bitmap.title: Bitmap
Bitmap.description: Summarize several digital inputs to one value by mapping each bit to a digital input.

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

5910.description: Integer in which each of the bits are associated with specific digital input value. Represented as a binary signed integer in network byte order, and in two's complement representation. Using values in range 0-127 is recommended to avoid ambiguities with byte order and negative values.

5912.description: The description of each bit as a string. First instance describes the least significant bit, second instance the second least significant bit.

Stopwatch.title: Stopwatch
Stopwatch.description: An ascending timer that counts how long time has passed since the timer was started after reset.

5501.description: The cumulative value of active state detected.

5544.description: The total time in seconds that the timer input is true. Writing a 0 resets the time.

5750.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance, “Air Pressure”.

5850.description: This resource represents a power source, which can be controlled, the setting of which is a Boolean value (1,0) where 1 is on and 0 is off

PowerupLog.title: PowerupLog
PowerupLog.description: An ascending timer that counts how long time has passed since the timer was started after reset.
